wikipedia_page.main: Paul McLaney (born 1975 in Stockton-on-Tees, England) is a New Zealand-based pop music composer, singer and guitarist.

response: Over the course of the season, the programme was supplemented with a range of enrichment activities including classes on stage, public talks, a book launch, and guided tours of the playhouse. Pop-up Globe also hosted a number of visiting productions for short engagements: the Auckland Summer Shakespeare presented 8 performances of The Tempest, Byrnes Productions presented 8 performances of Antony and Cleopatra, the Young Auckland Shakespeare Company presented 2 performances of a reverse-gender Much Ado About Nothing, the Lord Lackbeards presented 2 performances of their all-female Hamlet, Fractious Tash presented 4 performances of Titus Andronicus, Grae Burton Productions presented 4 performances of an all-female Henry V and the Ugly Shakespeare Company gave 3 performances of their schools version of Othello. Loop Media presented a one-night concert, Play On, in which a collection of NZ musicians performed Shakespeare soliloquies set to music by Paul McLaney.

link_mentions.page: Aotearoa Music Award for Best Solo Artist
